postText:
Interview we did with him in May 

 DeVante Wilson  (May 2, 2010), currently ranked  #248 

 N2FL:  At what age did you start playing football?  
  
 D.W.:   I started playing football when I was 11-years-old. 
  
 N2FL:  What was your favorite college team growing up?  
  
 D.W.:   Miami was my favorite college team and then I switched over to USC when I saw Reggie Bush play. 
  
 N2FL:  Have a favorite NFL Team?  
  
 D.W.:   The Raiders are my team for life. 
  
 N2FL:  Which is better, the NFL or college?  
  
 D.W.:   College is better in my opinion. 
  
 N2FL:  Do you try and emulate any specific player?  
  
 D.W.:   No, I just wanna be me. 
  
 N2FL:  Any particular reason for the jersey number?  
  
 D.W.:   I chose #11 because it was the year I was graduating high school and it was my junior year which is 11th grade and its my girlfriends basketball number. 
  
 N2FL:  What do you think of the current BCS system? Would you prefer a playoff?  
  
 D.W.:   I like the current BCS system. 
  
 N2FL:  When and who was your first scholarship offer?  
  
 D.W.:   Colorado was my first scholarship offer, last fall. 
  
 N2FL:  How many scholarship offers do you currently have?  
  
 D.W.:   I currently have 3 scholarship offers.  *To date Wilson has at least 10 offers to my knowledge* 
  
 N2FL:  Is there a school that hasn't offered you that you would like to see do so?  
  
 D.W.:   Yes, USC is the school I would like to receive an offer from. It's the school I've dreamed about playing for since I was a little kid. 
  
 N2FL:  What are some of the considerations you have when deciding between schools?  
  
 D.W.:   playing time, team chemistry, academics 
  
 N2FL:  Who are the schools currently on your list for consideration? Any leaders?  
  
 D.W.:   USC, UCLA, Arizona, Miami, Oregon, Washington, Alabama, Arizona State, Georgia, Florida State,  Nebraska , Texas Tech 
  
 N2FL:  Have you attended any schools Spring Game?  
  
 D.W.:   I attended UCLA's spring game last weekend. 
  
 N2FL:  Who is currently recruiting you the hardest?  
  
 D.W.:   The Pac-10 is recruiting me hard, and some other east coast schools. 
  
 N2FL:  Have you thought about who you might want to """"officially visit""""?  
  
 D.W.:   USC, UCLA, Miami, Arizona and Oregon are the schools I want to officially visit. 
  
 N2FL:  What positions are you being recruited to play?  
  
 D.W.:   I am being recruited to play DE. 
  
 N2FL:  What position would you prefer to play in college?  
  
 D.W.:   I want to play DE or as a standup rush linebacker. 
  
 N2FL:  What do you view as some of your playing strengths?  
  
 D.W.:   My strength, motor and tackling ability. 
  
 N2FL:  What are some things you would like to work on between now and college?  
  
 D.W.:   Between now and college I will want to work on everything, you can never be satisfied. 
  
 N2FL:  How would you feel about Redshirting?  
  
 D.W.:   I don't want to redshirt. I want to get on the field as quick as possible. 
  
 N2FL:  What is the most annoying aspect of the recruiting process?  
  
 D.W.:   Nothing is really annoying to me about the process, I just take it all in. 
  
 N2FL:  Do you have a major in mind?  
  
 D.W.:   I want to major in business. 
  
 N2FL:  What are your goals for your senior season?  
  
 D.W.:   My goals for my senior season are to get better, 15 sacks, and just have fun with my boys winning games. 
  
 N2FL:  What will you miss the most about high school?  
  
 D.W.:   I will miss playing on Friday nights in front of all of my friends and family. 
  
 N2FL:  What is the craziest recruiting """"pitch"""" you have heard so far?  
  
 D.W.:   I haven't really heard a crazy pitch yet. 
  
 N2FL:  Do you have a time frame as to when you would like to commit?  
  
 D.W.:   I want to commit during an All-American game - if I get invited to play in one. 
  
 N2FL:  In addition to """"National Letter of Intent Day' in February, should there be an early signing period like college basketball? Perhaps in August or November?  
  
 D.W.:   No I think it is good in February. That gives the prospects more time to make the best decision and they won't feel rushed. 
  
 N2FL:  Have you communicated with any prospective recruits about attending the same school?  
  
 D.W.:   No I haven't talked to any other prospects about attending the same school yet. 
  
 N2FL:  Who has been the biggest influence in your life?  
  
 D.W.:   My parents have been the biggest influence on my life.

I think it would cause more problems to districts.  Right now you have some really weird growth and expansion problems in the Klein District.  Have for years.  You build a new HS, but you demographics wind up being off a few years.  Parents fight redistricting to balance out. They took it out on the School Board and got most of the members replaced.  Didn't really do anything different, but it sure shook up district politics and hence, the administration.

Other districts have similar issues.  I think Wylie where our august former third team QB graduated from went from 2A to 5A very quickly and then they built another school.

I suspect this proposal may be an idea to formalize a split in the two divisions in 5A in the playoffs; only it permanently splits them.  They take all the teams that qualify and put them in smaller or larger category.

To answer your question, though I do not have first-hand knowledge of what recruits say to our coaches, the BIGGEST selling point Nebraska offers is its gameday atmosphere.  So, as it is in any sales job, you sell to your strengths and try to make them as prominent as possible.  That would be done at the game everyone has circled since last December.

As far as not getting the attention as if there were fewer high-profile recruits......you're right, they have to spread the wealth.  But remember that these coaches have been in contact with these young men for quite some time now, and we basically are just reiterating what we have been telling them since we have begun our conversations with them.  To be honest with you, the official visit for the Texas game will be more of an """"I told you what it was like to play football here, do you believe us now?  You ready to become a rockstar and commit?""""
